text:
Not necessarily for Facilities Pager channel, but I'm wondering if we have any way to optimize some of the HVAC systems a bit to help some habitually hot/cold rooms throughout the day. 

Case in point â€” An afternoon meeting in Oak is like a sweat lodge. I suspect this is because outside the room, the thermostat thinks it's a cool 70. Wonder if there's any way to time particular HVAC systems to be on at points of day. So in this case, in the afternoon that unit kicks on. 

I know there's a maze of pipes and systems. Anything we can do to train those systems a bit further?
OR install one of the additional units for any rooms that fall in this trap
there are in fact tickets open for those
i'm not deep in the tools.
Simple answer is we work on it and it will never be perfect
So complain away when it's not comfortable
And we will see what we can do to work on that days situation
